content.html:
Yeah, it's like 3 days late.

It's been an interesting Christmas. Not that it was bad, just interesting. My parents, now fully moved in down here, are involved. That makes an already split Christmas a bit more complex. In a good way. We're all still trying to feel out how it's going to work going forward, but I can see things should go well.

Work is very, very slow. It's one of the reasons I started re-using my Mastodon account. Using my Mastodon account made me realize that I really just can't handle it. So I closed it.

Thankfully, I have a Switch and, now, a Steam deck to occupy my time. The deck is good enough for me to completely remove Steam from my laptop, along with all the games and (mercifully) all the i386 compatibility libraries that were taking up so much space. It's all a bit snappier.

I'm not sure if I'll keep this write.as account much longer. It's expensive for what you get, but it does have the convenience of just typing into a box and hitting publish, so there's that.

Hopefully you and yours had a good Christmas, or whatever holiday you participate in. The end of the year is a good time to reflect and understand yourself better and celebrate each other. I know I need to do more of that.

Merry Christmas!

content.html:
I could stick with one blog system? Yeah, I didn't think so. @kev@fosstodon.org has the same problem.

Churn makes life less boring.

Discuss...
